author: Larry Patterso.
comment: I bet that I could get a free music player that works better than this one. First, it plays the same songs everyday. I walk 1-2 hours and hear about 50% of the same songs everyday, I have 800 songs on my phone and like everyone of them. Second, when you try and fast forward to the next song you didn't hear the day before it gets stuck on one song and takes me 5 minutes to find the  main menu to switch back to shuffle, which sucks while you are trying to get some exercise. Third, why did they hide the main menu, I have a Samsung S7 Edge and have a heck of a time trying to find the menu to reset my shuffle.

author: Mel C
comment: One of my favorite apps. Easy to use, lots of different functions and does far more than other music players. There is a trial version if you're unsure, but when you play around with it you'll more than likely want the full version. Love the 5, 30, 60 second rwd/ffwd feature and that I can open it over other apps.
title: Excellent music player

author: A December
comment: This app was amazing when I first got it, until the shuffling got reworked and started shuffling your entire playlist instead of randomly selecting a track from the alphabetically ordered library. You can still get it to work properly if you load up your entire library and then manually change the playlist to shuffle, but that's far from ideal while on the road, and worse still it seems to still play the next consecutive track before actually shuffling. Lyrics broke a while back too. Used to be 5/5. 😧
title: Great player but the functionality is worsening

author: Matthew Lloyd
comment: Playing music via Chromecast does NOT work properly. Every time I try to play a song from an artist that has multiple songs, it point blank refuses to play that particular song and instead runs though every other song by that artist in quick succession with no music playing until it reaches the last song and just plays that instead. It ONLY does this when connected to my Chromecast Audio. This needs fixing ASAP.
title: TERRIBLE Chromecast Support

author: Derek Walker
comment: While using the app the screen will go black and I have no control at all. After restart it will work fine for a while. Also since I installed I have been unable to get any lyrics to download. Been a long time user of your app, WebOS days, nice work on this version. Device is an S6.
title: Screen go's black have to restart and no lyrics at all.

author: suzanne ashby
comment: This app is fantastic, the only problem, and it's a pretty big annoyance, is that when on random it will play the same song many times on a playlist and never hits all of them. I wish it was programmed to play every song once on random. You can only hear the same song repeatedly on a run so many times before it slowly drives you insane.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Select "shuffle playlist" from the "..." menu next to a playlist and it will play the songs in random order without any repeats.

title: Only one thing to make it perfect

comment: I searched high and low for an app that allowed me to jump backwards and forwards by short increments  (e.g. 5 seconds, 30 seconds, etc.), and this is the one I finally settled on.    I'm now on my third phone with this app.  My one complaint is that the settings don't carry over from the trial version to the paid version.  If I configure the trial app to my liking, later when I buy it, I have to start all over again.

author: Stephen Doncov
comment: I first got introduced to this product on the Palm Pre's.  Loved it then and I purchased it now for my Android devices (now a Blackberry Priv).  But, been getting several malfunctions.  For one, in the middle of creating my playlists, it no longer can find any music.  I have to shut it down and reboot.  This has been happening frequently lately and is very annoying.  Need this fixed.  I will give it 4 stars but that is a generous rating.

author: Bianca Johnson
comment: It's really good with everything besides the shuffle mode.  When I set it to shuffle it picks like 6 songs and repeats them over and over, out of a playlist of over 100 songs. It's annoying, I liked the app enough to pay for it,  but to listen to a shuffled playlist, I have use a different app.

author: Darren H Presley
comment: Love this player, great sound & easy to use apart from one thing I am having trouble with & that is how do I locate my SD card & import  the music from it so I can create play list?? I would gladly give 5 stars if I could sort this out. I am planning on using this player/app for my gigs as I am a vocalist so obviously I need to access all my tracks & create & save my set lists.
title: Great but one question?

author: Michael Parcell
comment: This was a great player (5 star) but now it is not worth the money I paid for it.  They disabled the downloading lyric feature and it no longer shows the lyrics that are embedded in the MP3s.  Look elsewhere for a music player.

author: Evan Leclerc
comment: I had a problem and the creator of the app helped me out within minutes. Thank you Hedami, sorry for being so forgetful.

author: Griffin Stuip
comment: I've tried a many music players. This is one of the few ones with a search button just a swipe away. When I come across an artist I like during shuffle mode, I can look at the artists songs or album lists with a single click. "Play next", "Add to queue", simple functions that are sometimes hard to come by. As an amateur musician, bookmarking certain sections of songs is an absolute treasure to have. This and the ability to skip forward or backwards 5, 30 or 60 seconds with the touch of a button.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content:
Autolists are generated based on the plays within the app.

Be sure to check out the various aesthetic customization options (available via the top-left icon in the right-side sliding panel).  You'd be amazing how drastically you can change the look of the app.  And I find myself changing it all the time to suit my current tastes.

author: Tyrone Moore
comment: By far the easiest app I've found for auto getting music cover art and editing tags!Not to mention a very classy music player,top notch dev!!!!!!!!
title: Wow

author: Juan Hernandez
comment: Has all the functions I need and then some. Developer updates the app and is very responsive. 5 star worthy.
title: Very nice music player

author: Ryan Healey
comment: Brilliant app, almost perfect but the shuffle tends to play some songs over and over and some songs not at all.
title: Needs better shuffle

author: Grayson Culwell
comment: This is definitely the best music player that I've found, but it can't play embedded lyrics. Do you think you could add that in as a feature?
title: Lyrics

author: James M
comment: Great poweruser app, especially for podcasts and mixes. Can add bookmarks within track and instantly jump to them. Saves your spot in track. Autoplay on start option.

author: TheBurningsteppes
comment: Still my go to for playing files locally. It just works.

author: Clyde Moore
comment: Nice app but will not play music when I try to Chrome-cast to my TV. All other chrome cast apps work perfectly. When I cast music using this app, when the song opens, the counter changes to the negative of the length of the song and nothing plays. Any help would be appreciated.
title: Need Help

author: Dennis Ruijl
comment: I've been using it for years and consider it to be the best app so far. It has anything I could want, especially the 'skip 5, 30 or 60 seconds' buttons, rearranging current playlist and popping up from every app. But, I've just rooted and upgraded my phone and run cyanogenmod 12. Upon installing I get the error message "audio fx has stopped" every second. (!) this unfortunately renders it useless for me. Hope it's fixable.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: I googled "audiofx has stopped" and this is a common issue with cyanogenmod.  Read some of the articles...there are a few recommended fixes there.

title: Best one so far, but

author: Luana Candido
comment: I love the app but this big disc right in the middle cant see the background. Is annoying.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: The middle part of the screen is the album art.  Most music apps display album art on the Now Playing screen.  If you're seeing a big disk, it means there is no album art saved for the song/album you're listening to.  You can download album art by tapping the "..." next to a song and selecting "Download album art".

title: Please help

author: Logan Barney
comment: So many features, insanely awesome support

author: William Lewis
comment: I can actually call this a "fun" mp3 player app. I dig the customizable backgrounds, and such. The 'shuffle' functions are a bit predictable, though. Otherwise, a player I'll use for a while. That's saying alot.
title: Galaxy SIII

author: Bret Carlson
comment: A quick note, I generally don't review mobile apps, but this one gets a rare exception. The S4 stock media player was no longer cutting it, and I desperately needed a replacement. Downloaded the trial and within 30 minutes bought the app. Thank you for being one of the last few developers who grasps UI design. The built in wiki references are inspired. I really wish the app had gapless playback and maybe the option to show play control buttons, but regardless, the app is still miles better than any other.
title: Sold...

author: Shadowside
comment: My first choice of all my music players.
title: Great music app

author: Mark Pound
comment: Best yet
title: Mark pound

author: Jim Karaway
comment: My favorite music app. Just an all around intelligent design
title: Good stuff

author: Felix M F
comment: The app is great on my phone but for some reason, the only thing I can control from my moto 360 is the volume. I can't pause or seek tracks. Please fix this issue and I will give 5 stars.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Be sure that on the "Lockscreen & Remote Control" prefs screen "Enable remote control" is selected. Otherwise music controls won't work. If that's not the issue, please email me (support link on the app's Help screen and in the Play Store listing) with more details such as your phone model, phone OS version, details of what you see on Moto 360.

title: Wont Pause/Skip/Previous on moto 360

author: Maxim C.
comment: Can't say the same about its graphical part… It needs some polishing
title: I really enjoy a lot player's functionalities

author: Mark Clemons
comment: I've been using this app on WebOS for a while, and now it can be my goto music app on android.  Very feature rich but not as pretty as the WebOS version.  Well... you can't have everything from android.
title: good dev

author: Timothy Hachey
comment: Loving it so far. The layout is not what I'm used to; however, the more I use it, the more I realize it's superior.
title: Nice

author: tony romano
comment: Won't allow skip/rewind since system update. Always happens when finally decide to buy an app. Uninstall for now.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: This issue is fixed in version 1.6.3.

title: Used to work on moto 360.

author: fred owens
comment: True. I should've Known better. You're fantastic with addressing my concerns. I'm on it.
title: Htc one M8

author: Aaron Ferby
comment: Best Money ever spent!

author: Martin Doherty
comment: Top Developer Top App he spent 2 days mailing me to sort out my gb problem above and beyond is this developer and cares for his customers treble the stars if i could

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Thanks again for helping me test my Gingerbread package installation fix.

title: Top marks

author: David Stein
comment: All this time and it still can't do something PowerAmp has been doing for over 4 years now - let you chose where your music is located. Unfortunately without this simple "feature" the app is completely unusable for me. I would have thought by now this major technical hurdle would have been overcome.

reply.author: Hedami
reply.content: Music Player (Remix) has always focused on music management via tags vs. folders.  The primary goal of Music Player (Remix) is creating a unique experience that cannot be found elsewhere.  While folder management is on my list, more unique features will take precedence.  Unfortunately I don't have unlimited time available to work on everything!

title: Seriously? I still can't point it to a folder?

author: Fam Kieboom
comment: Because that's how I am organized. Quite normal, don't you think? Uninstall, until then 😢
title: Folder support needed

author: Remington Crawford
comment: I enjoy this player, and love the swipe up control. My issue was addressed and resolved by the developer within hours. Great job, and thank you!
title: Sleek, fast developer response

author: Eric Tsai
comment: Excellent player and developer! Super quick at answering question. Player is easy to use and has many options. Thanks for making a great app!
